SingleDraft is an AI legal writing assistant integrated into Microsoft Word. It helps legal professionals draft, review, and improve legal documents by providing access to defined terms, external information, and model clauses.
SingleDraft works with Microsoft Word on both Windows and macOS. The minimum Word version is Office 2019, all features are available in Word 365.
Currently, SingleDraft's interface is in English, but it can process documents across languages. External information (see External Information) are jurisdiction-specific.
documents.s: Is SingleDraft available in languages other than English?

documents.t: You can install SingleDraft directly from Microsoft AppSource. For detailed instructions, see our Installation Guide.

This could be due to several reasons: The add-in may not be enabled in Word You might need to restart Word Your organization's security settings might be blocking add-ins For troubleshooting steps, see our Troubleshooting Guide.
documents.s: I cannot see the SingleDraft add-in after installation?

documents.t: For individual installation, you do not need administrator rights. For enterprise deployment, administrator access to your Microsoft 365 admin center is required.
documents.s: Do I need administrator rights to install SingleDraft?

documents.t: The AI assistant analyzes the context of your open document and uses this understanding to provide relevant suggestions and answers. It can also leverage your internal data if you have connected it to SingleDraft. We make a range of legal-specific adjustments to how the AI works in the context of legal documents.
documents.s: How does the AI assistant work with my documents?

documents.t: Yes, SingleDraft can connect to your internal documents through our Internal Data Synchronization feature. This allows the system to suggest relevant clauses from your own documents.
documents.s: Can SingleDraft access my internal document database?

documents.t: No. SingleDraft requires an internet connection to function, as it uses cloud-based AI services and needs to access your synchronized data.
We use industry-standard encryption methods to protect your data in transit and at rest. For more information about our security practices, visit SingleDraft Security.
No.
documents.s: Is my data used for any training?

documents.t: If you are into any issues, please try to close/open the SingleDraft plugin and update your Word version to the latest. If the problem persists, please contact us at info@singledraft.ai
Natively integrated into MS Word, using the knowledge of your internal data and the context of the opened document, the AI assistant allows for targeted and context-aware answers.

We offer a range of customization options for the AI assistant. You can choose your preferred language model and its provider, set the overall tone and style of answers, save and reuse workflows using 'Shortcuts'. In addition, AI uses in the background the context of the opened document, as well as to your internal data that you have uploaded.

The AI assistant can be used to edit the opened document. You can select the text you want to edit and the AI will suggest changes, again informed by the context of the opened document and your internal data. You can then accept or reject the suggested changes.
Answers, which are based on the opened document, are provided with citations that allow for an easy checking of parts of the answer against the source text.

For actions you commonly use, create a simple shortcut to trigger the action. You can start filtering the action by typing '/' in the chat and then selecting the desired action from the list. You can use keyboard arrows to navigate through the list, and press Enter to select the action (this will send the prompt directly to the chat). Alternatively, you can scroll and select the action to paste its content into the input field, to further edit it.

SingleDraft offers a range of powerful features to enhance your legal document workflow: AI Assistant - AI integrated into MS Word, powered by your internal data Snippets - Search and insert clauses from your internal data Definition Tracking - Track and manage defined terms in your documents Checks - Validate your documents for common formal issues External Information - Connect your documents with external data sources
The plugin displays a number of specific alerts for legal writing. These alerts include include the types of alerts listed below.

In case of conflicting definitions (i.e., a single concept defined more than once), definitions that are drafted in a non-standard manner, or definitions that are not used in the document, the corresponding alert is then displayed in the definition card. In the 'Occurrences' tab, we also validate if all mentions of the defined term are consistently capitalized and that the defined term is being used before any other occurrences.
This alert verifies numerical consistency throughout the document. It activates when there are discrepancies between figures in numerical and written form.

The holiday alert checks the dates mentioned in the document against a database of public holidays and weekends. It notifies the user if a date coincides with a (future) holiday, which could have legal and practical implications.

The alert is triggered when the document contains a clause to be filled in, e.g., "The parties agree that the [insert date] is the date of the agreement." We check for common placeholders, highlighted text and other indicators of a template.

Unbalanced brackets can lead to confusion in interpreting the document's provisions. This alert detects any (mismatched parentheses)), braces, or square brackets to prevent potential misreadings of the contract's terms.
The standard number check verifies the format and structure of the numbers in the document. We check the validity of birth numbers, bank account numbers (including IBAN format) and others.

For each company listed in the document, the plugin checks whether the company name is mentioned close to the ID number. In addition, if a company ID mentioned that is not found in the corresponding public register, the plugin will display an alert. Supported for 🇨🇭,🇨🇿, 🇸🇰, 🇭🇷.
documents.s: Correctness of company names, company ID existence

documents.t: If a parcel is listed in the document, the plugin checks if the parcel is in the (Czech) land register and whether the correct parcel type is specified. Supported for 🇨🇿.
documents.s: Checking the existence and type of a parcel

documents.t: With respect to internal links to a certain part of the document, the plugin checks whether this link is created using Word's "Cross-reference" feature. Without using this feature, it may occur when if the document is edited and renumbered, a mismatch between the reference and the target location takes place.
SingleDraft checks whether the statute mentioned in the document is a valid statute in a given jurisdiction. If the statute is not valid, the plugin will display an alert. Supported for 🇨🇿

This feature helps you find and understand defined terms in your legal documents. Instead of searching through the entire document to find what a term means, the system shows you the definition right away.
Select any defined term to see its meaning in the sidebar Jump to where the term is defined in the document by clicking the "split window" icon Find definitions from anywhere in your document
When a definition contains other defined terms, these are highlighted Click on any highlighted term to see its definition too

The system alerts you about: Defined terms that are never used in the document Terms defined more than once Inconsistent capitalization (example: defining "Agreement" but later writing "agreement") You can dismiss any alert you do not need
Compare definitions with those in your other documents Requires connecting your internal files first (see Internal Data Synchronization)
You can view definitions in two ways: Select a term directly in your document text Browse the list of defined terms in the "cards" tab Use the search bar to find specific terms

When you select a term, you'll see a card in the sidebar showing: The complete definition of the term Any other defined terms within that definition (highlighted) An "Occurrences" tab that shows all places where the term appears in your document Word Forms SingleDraft recognizes different forms and declensions of the same word. For example, if "Contract" is defined, it will also find "Contracts" in your document.

The external information feature enriches your legal documents by automatically integrating external data from various authoritative sources. This ensures that references to companies, statutory provisions, and plots of land within your documents are accurate and up-to-date.

When a company name is mentioned within a document, the feature cross-references this mention with data from Companies House and individual credit score databases in selected jurisdictions. We also allow you to search for a company in the Companies House by its name or ID number, via the 'Registers' tab. Supported for companies in 🇨🇭,🇨🇿, 🇸🇰, 🇭🇷.
This feature links mentions of statutory provisions directly to their corresponding texts. Users are able to access the exact wording of laws referenced within their documents. Supported in 🇨🇿.
For the parcels mentioned in the text, we display the available information from the Land Registry, checking their existence and the correct type of parcel in the text. Supported in 🇨🇿.
Find useful clauses in your internal database and add them to your document. info To learn how to connect your internal data, see Internal Data Synchronization.

In the background, our search system finds relevant clauses in two ways: Keyword search: Finds exact words you type Meaning-based search: Understands the context and meaning of what you need This combined approach helps you find the most useful clauses, even when they use different words to express the same idea.

The system automatically adds information to your documents, such as: Language (English, Spanish, etc.) Party names Document type This lets you narrow down search results without manual tagging. As you select filters, both the results and other filter options update automatically.
Favorites: Mark clauses you use often for quick access Tags: Add labels to clauses so your team can find them easily
Search by Selection: Drag text from your document to the search bar to find similar clauses Compare Text: Drag text between your document and search results to see differences (redline comparison)

Thank you for your interest in SingleDraft, the AI legal writing assistant integrated into MS Word. Our solution provides a layer of insights over a contract opened in MS Word: connecting information within the document (such as defined terms), connecting with external information (such as information from Company House), and providing suggestions on model clauses based on the internal database. SingleDraft is built with respect for your craft, leaving you in control of the document at all times and providing you with the insights you need to make the best decisions.
The plugin is available for both Windows and Mac platforms. For installation steps follow this link.

Choose the installation method that best fits your needs: Individual Installation - For individual users who want to install the add-in directly from Microsoft AppSource Enterprise Deployment - For organizations with Office 365 Business or Enterprise licenses who want to deploy to multiple users Troubleshooting - If you encounter any issues during installation
The plugin can be added into user's add-ins directly in the Word using Microsoft AppSource.
Go to Home tab in MS Word and click on Add-ins Click on More Add-ins Click on Store and in the search field search for Single Draft Click on Add button The Add-in is visible in My Add-Ins
This guide shows how to install the add-in for multiple users at once in your organization. It follows the official Microsoft installation guide.

You will need: The so-called manifest file: download manifest Microsoft Office 365 account with one of these admin roles: Global Administrator Azure Application Administrator Exchange Administrator Users must have one of these license types: Microsoft 365 Business (Basic, Standard, or Premium) Office 365 Enterprise (E1, E3, E5, or F3) Microsoft 365 Enterprise (E3, E5, or F3) For complete requirements, see the Microsoft documentation.

Go To Microsoft Office 365 - On the left sidebar click Admin icon. Go to Settings > Integrated apps. Click on Upload custom apps. Select App type = Office Add-in Upload manifest XML - Choose Upload manifest file from device and use the file provided above Click Next and Add users: - Keep the toggle for test deployment to No - assign which users should be able to see and use the Add-in Finish deployment Click Next Accept permission request by clicking Next Click Finish deployment Go to Home tab in MS Word and click on Add-ins Sign in to MS Word Make sure to be signed in the MS Word with the account that is among the approved accounts that were assigned in previous step. Click on More Add-in The Add-in should be visible among other Admin Managed Add-ins Do not see the plugin at this point? Try refreshing the dialog

This section covers settings and integrations for SingleDraft: Internal Data Synchronization - Connect SingleDraft with your SharePoint and other systems User Management - Manage users, authentication, roles, and subscriptions External Services Integration - Configure API keys for DeepL, Cadastre, and CreditCheck

If you cannot see Admin section in Microsoft 365 account it means you do not have sufficient rights. Please refer to this Microsoft webpage for full set of requirements for adding MS Add-in into Integrated Apps.
Only Business and Enterprise licenses support adding MS Add-in into Integrated Apps. Please refer to this Microsoft webpage for a full set of requirements for adding MS Add-in into Integrated Apps.
It can happen that your MS Word customization does not have Add-ins button at the Home tab of the MS Word.

When you have any MS Word document open, click on File This will open side bar, select Get Add-ins In case you do not see this icon either, please follow these steps: Click on File again At the bottom of the sidebar there is Options This will open new window Click on Customize Ribbon Add Add-ins to Home tab

This section covers all aspects of managing users, authentication, roles, and subscriptions: Authentication - How users sign in and access the system Administrators - Different administrator roles and their permissions Subscription - Managing subscriptions and user access
SingleDraft can integrate with various external services to enhance its functionality. As a Team Admin, you can add API keys for the following services:
DeepL integration allows for high-quality translations directly within the SingleDraft plugin.

Go to Settings > API keys Find the DeepL section Enter your DeepL API key in the provided field Click Save Once configured, all users in your organization will be able to use DeepL translation services when working with documents.
Cadastre integration enables SingleDraft to verify and provide information about land parcels mentioned in your documents.
Go to Settings > API keys Find the Cadastre section Enter your Cadastre API key in the provided field Click Save
CreditCheck integration allows SingleDraft to verify company information and credit ratings when mentioned in documents.

Go to Settings > API keys Find the CreditCheck section Enter your CreditCheck API key in the provided field Click Save This integration enhances the accuracy of company information displayed in your documents. info All API keys are securely stored and only accessible to users with Team Admin privileges. tip If you don't have API keys for these services, contact the respective service providers to obtain them.
To use the plugin securely, users must authenticate within the plugin. There are two methods of authentication:
This authentication flow requires the user to register with an email and password.

Click the Register button on the plugin login page. Fill in the email and password fields. A verification email will be sent to the user's email (check the spam folder if necessary). In the verification email, click the verification button. Once verified, the user can proceed to log in. Use the same email and password to log in.
For users who prefer to use enterprise Azure AD authentication.

Click the Login button on the plugin login page. Click the Microsoft Azure AD button. Log in with the Azure AD account. A prompt to approve the Single Draft application will appear. Approve it, or ask your IT admin to approve it, depending on the user's Azure AD settings. Once approved, the login process is complete. For subsequent logins, no further approval is needed.
PairLegal has two special user roles with extra permissions: Team Admin Data Manager

There are two ways to get Team Admin status: Create a subscription: When you create a subscription and pay the first invoice, you automatically become a Team Admin. Get assigned by another Team Admin: Any existing Team Admin can give this role to other users.
documents.s: How to Become a Team Admin

documents.t: Before you start, make sure: You already have the Team Admin role yourself You have at least one user in your company subscription Steps to follow: Go to Settings > Users management Click on Your users Find the user in the list Click the three dots (⋮) in the Actions column Select Make Team Admin
documents.s: How to Make Someone a Team Admin

documents.t: Manage Subscriptions: Cancel subscriptions they have paid for View all company subscriptions See all users in each subscription Add users to subscriptions Remove users from subscriptions Manage Roles: Give the Team Admin role to other users Give the Data Manager role to other users Manage Company Data: Set up, change, or remove company secrets (like API keys)
Ask any Team Admin in your company to give you this role.
documents.s: How to Become a Data Manager

documents.t: Before you start, make sure: You already have the Team Admin role yourself You have at least one user in your company subscription Steps to follow: Go to Settings > Users management Click on Your users Find the user in the list Click the three dots (⋮) in the Actions column Select Make Data Manager
documents.s: How to Make Someone a Data Manager

documents.t: Manage Company Settings: Set up, change, or remove company settings (like system prompts)
We are here to help with any questions or issues you may have with SingleDraft.
For questions, feedback, or support requests, please email us at: info@singledraft.ai
You can also contact us directly from the SingleDraft plugin: Look for the chat icon in the bottom-right corner Click on the icon to open the chat window Type your message and send it

When reporting a bug, ideally please include: A description of what happened Steps to reproduce the problem File that caused the issue Your operating system information (Windows, macOS, etc.) and Word version This helps us fix issues faster.
Your feedback helps make SingleDraft better. We welcome all comments and suggestions about your experience.

SingleDraft offers monthly and yearly subscription options, with invoices generated automatically at the end of each billing cycle. Each subscription is based on the number of seats your organisation requires. To purchase a subscription, you must have an existing SingleDraft account. During the subscription process, you'll specify the number of seats needed - this determines how many team users can be added to your subscription.

After completing your payment, you'll need to allocate seats to specific team users. If you have Team Admin privileges, please follow these steps at this link after the payment succeeded. info The person who purchases the subscription is automatically added as a user to the subscription.
By syncing your internal data, you can search in your files for the right clause and enhance any AI-based suggestions.
SingleDraft seamlessly connects with your SharePoint documents, enhancing your existing document management workflow. Here's how to set it up:

warning User doing this step must have Privileged Role Administrator role in their Azure Entra tenant. Navigate to our Consent initiation page Sign in to your SingleDraft account (or create one if you have not already). You will see an option to initiate the permission process. The consent is about you giving access to our application to read files and user groups in your SharePoint. Upon confirmation, you will be directed to Microsoft's consent page where you can review and approve the requested permissions.

Please provide the customer support team with the following information: Your SharePoint Site URL that contains folder(s) for synchronization, e.g., https://<your-domain>.sharepoint.com/sites/<name-of-your-site> Relative paths to folders that contains the documents for synchronization, e.g., templates/curated

SingleDraft manages access through SharePoint's existing group structure. The system: References the user group matching your SharePoint site name Grants access to users based on their email addresses within that group Maintains your existing permission hierarchy info If the group name is different from the Site name please let us know during onboarding. info Make sure that the access model aligns with your organization's security requirements.
Once configured, your documents will be available in the SingleDraft plugin within a few hours. The system will maintain ongoing synchronization to ensure your content stays current.
